author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...CHANTAL MOVING INTO NORTHERN NORTH CAROLINA... ...FLASH FLOOD THREAT CONTINUES AS RAINBANDS MOVE ACROSS NORTHERN NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTH-CENTRAL VIRGINIA...
summary: ...CHANTAL MOVING INTO NORTHERN NORTH CAROLINA... ...FLASH FLOOD THREAT CONTINUES AS RAINBANDS MOVE ACROSS NORTHERN NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTH-CENTRAL VIRGINIA... As of 11:00 PM EDT Sun Jul 06 the center of Chantal was located near 35.9, -78.7 with movement NE at 12 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 30 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...CHANTAL MOVING INTO NORTHERN NORTH CAROLINA... ...FLASH FLOOD THREAT CONTINUES AS RAINBANDS MOVE ACROSS NORTHERN NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTH-CENTRAL VIRGINIA... As of 11:00 PM EDT Sun Jul 06 the center of Chantal was located near 35.9, -78.7 with movement NE at 12 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 30 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Depression Chantal (AT3/AL032025)
